intro: Gomesa gravesiana, commonly known as the slender gomesia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Gomesa gravesiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
